article: Every year on my birthday, from the time I turned twelve, a white gardenia was delivered to my house. No card or note came with it. _ to the flower shop were always useless---it was a cash _ . After a while I stopped trying to _ who the sender was and just delighted in the beautiful and perfume of the white flower. But I never _ imagining who the sender might be. Some of my _ moments were spent daydreaming about it.My mother asked me whether there was someone for whom I had done a(n) _ kindness who might be showing _ . Perhaps the neighbor I helped when she was _ a car full of groceries. Or maybe it was the old man _ the street whose mail I helped to get during the _ so he wouldn t have to venture down his icy step. As a teenager, _ , I had more fun guessing that it might be a _ who had noticed me _ I didn t know him.One month before my high school graduation, my father died of a heart attack. He was _ some of the most important events in my life. I became completely _ in my upcoming graduation and the dance. When my father died, I _ the dance and the dress for it. The day before the dance, I found a dress on the sofa. I didn t _ if I had a new dress or not, but my mother did.She wanted her children to feel _ and lovable, imaginative, believing that there was a _ in the world and beauty in the face of hard times. Actually mother wanted her children to see themselves much like the gardenia-lovely, _ and perfect. The gardenia stopped coming when my mother died
